subject: Re: Is this an acceptable style?
msgSnippet: ... Sounds like A needs refactoring. ... If it s not a useful abstraction, I think I d argue against extracting an it as an interface. If it is then it should
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jonathan Oddy <j.oddy@s...> wrote:

> So within my unit tests I mock class A, although from inspection of
> A, it smells rather pungent and cannot be easily mocked.
> <snip>
> all the "nasty" code within A.

Sounds like A needs refactoring.

> But now my question, I've extracted this interface but where should
> I put it?

If it's not a useful abstraction, I think I'd argue against
extracting an it as an interface.

If it is then it should be in it's own. I tend to frown on local or
inner classes/interfacs.

Dave
